alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Gilmer; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Roane; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy showers and thunderstorms impacting portions of central Calhoun, west central Randolph, southern Gilmer, southeastern Lewis, Braxton, Upshur, central Roane and northeastern Webster Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 955 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy showers and thunderstorms. Brief but repetitive downpours combined with rainfall earlier today could lead to water running down hillsides and across roads, as well as high water in areas of poor drainage. The heaviest of the rain had moved out of Roane and Calhoun counties. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...In wet soils, it will not take much wind to knock down small trees. Locations impacted include... Spencer, Sutton, Gassaway, Arnoldsburg, Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Cedar Creek State Park, Burnsville, Flatwoods, Shock, Millstone, Alexander, Eden, Rosedale, Mount Zion, Helvetia, Cleveland, Pickens, Hacker Valley and Kanawha Head. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 62 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall occurring with these showers and thunderstorms may lead to localized flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Move to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Calhoun; Gilmer; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Roane; Southeast Randolph; Upshur
